titleStmt.title: A vindication of the case relating to the greenwax fines shewing how the rights and prerogative of the Crown are diminished, officers enriched, and the subjects oppressed by the mismanagement of that revenue : also, disproving the allegations used to hinder a reformation thereof, as contradictory to the reports and resolutions of the judges and lawyers, and the experience of persons of all ranks and degrees in all ages.
titleStmt.author: Brunskell, Percivall, 17th cent.

notesStmt.note: "Proved by undenyable matter upon record, against which the law alloweth no plea or averiment."
Dedication to Charles II signed: P. Brunskell.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
